verses.roman:
prabhu kahe,--"sūtrera artha bujhiye nirmala
tomāra vyākhyā śuni' mana haya ta' vikala

synonyms: prabhu kahe—the Lord replied; sūtrera artha—the meaning of the sūtras; bujhiye—I can understand; nirmala—very clearly; tomāra—your; vyākhyā—explanation; śuni'-hearing; mana—mind; haya—becomes; ta'-indeed; vikala—disturbed.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu then revealed His mind, saying, "I can understand the meaning of each sūtra very clearly, but your explanations have simply agitated My mind.

purport.content: The factual meaning of the aphorismsof the Vedānta-sūtra is as clear as sunshine. The Māyāvādī philosophers simply try to cover the sunshine with the clouds of interpretations imagined by Śaṅkarācārya and his followers.
